intro: Nonea auriculata, commonly known as the ear-shaped daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Nonea auriculata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
